value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: Dynamically change chart axis in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick builds on a blog post from Scott Senkeresty to dynamically change the axis of your visual within Power BI. This uses a combination of Power Query and DAX.  Chris Cook - @Finalyst89  Scott Senkeresty â€“ @ScottSenkeresty  Dynamically changing chart axis http://tinylizard.com/dynamically-changing-chart-axis/

value.title: How to create and use a Power BI Hierarchy
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how to create and use a Power BI Hierarchy within Power BI Desktop. Hierarchies can help to provide correct data usage within your Power BI reports.  Sample Download: https://guyinacu.be/hierarchysample  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.excerpt: Have you struggled when dragging month name to a chart axis and it is sorted alphabetically in Power BI Desktop? Adam shows you how you can change the sort order to be chronologically instead of alphabetically. This technique can also be used for other categorical columns in Power BI.  ******** LET'S

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.

value.title: Embed a dashboard from Power BI into your application
value.excerpt: In this video, I go over the embed a dashboard sample and walk you through how to actually embed a dashboard into your application. This uses a combination of the Power BI REST APIs and the JavaScript API.  Embed Dashboards in Your Applications to Monitor Your Business in Context (Blog) - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/embed-dashboard/

value.title: Help your Power BI report users with an Information Panel
value.excerpt: Do your Power BI users understand your report? Chances are, at least not all of it. Help them out with an information panel to help describe the report and understand all of the capabilities. value.title: Dynamic filtering with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at taking URL filtering to the next level. He shows how to use dynamic filtering with Power BI reports. value.title: Power BI Slicers vs Filters - which will you choose?
value.excerpt: Adam picks up on David Eldersveld's blog about Power BI slicers versus filters and looks at if slicers are even needed now. The filter pane can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  David Eldersveld blog - https://dataveld.com/2019/01/18/are-power-bi-slicers-still-relevant-with-the-new-filter-pane/

value.excerpt: Are you using a flat table in your Power BI report? You may be missing out! Patrick explores what a STAR SCHEMA is and why you should be using it. value.title: STOP publishing your Power BI report until you do these 5 things!
value.excerpt: Your Power BI report could be slow and not functional. Publishing to Power BI may also show you your ugly baby. value.title: Showing actuals and forecasts in the same chart with Power BI
value.excerpt: In budgeting reports, a common requirement is to show future sales forecast and actual sales volume on the same line chart. Learn how to achieve this goal using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/73386?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: DAX Fridays by Curbal
value.excerpt: Are you new to DAX or are you having problems with a specific DAX function? In this playlist, I cover a new DAX function every friday, so you and I can learn DAX in depth.

topItems.title: DAX Fridays! #1: How to write DAX measures....fast in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: DAX Fridays! #1: How to write DAX measures....fast in Power BI  In today's video I will show you how to write Power BI measures quickly and even how to format them.  PREVIOUS VIDEO: - NEXT VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kC3w_KVVabY   Looking for a download file? Go to our Download Center: https://curbal.com/donwload-center
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pabn7kLxN6c" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: DAX Fridays! #2: CALENDAR, CALENDARAUTO
topItems.excerpt: Create a calendar with DAX in Power BI. Generate/ Create calendars in DAX using CALENDAR() and/or CALENDARAUTO().  Video keynotes: 01:02 Calendarauto function 03:02 Calendar function  Link to Power BI file and Curbal Glossary: https://curbal.com/blog/create-power-bi-custom-calendars  PREVIOUS VIDEO:
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kC3w_KVVabY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: DAX Fridays! #3: SUM and SUMX
topItems.excerpt: Dax Fridays! Today we will go through: how to use SUM() and SUMX(), the difference between them and when should we use one vs the other.  The DAX SUM function calculates the sum of all numbers in a column while the DAX SUMX function returns the sum of an expression for each row in a table.  02:28 Create
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vcYz0XPklXg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: DAX Fridays! #4: COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTX, COUNTAX, DISTINCTCOUNT AND COUNTROWS in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Let's go through all the count expressions available in DAX!  Here you have the keynotes for the video so you can jump to the function you want to learn:  02:44 COUNT text (#ERROR) 03:24 COUNT numbers 04:20 COUNT blanks 04:56 COUNT dates 05:36 COUNTA text 06:44 COUNTA numbers 07:27 COUNTX 09:16 COUNTAX
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/V8wYTjKyvgk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Best kept SECRET in Power BI??? You tell us!
value.excerpt: Have we found the best kept SECRET in Power BI? Adam saw this recently and was BLOWN away! Zooming in can help with presenting in business settings and anywhere else. Here are a few things you can use to make that presentation better with Power BI.  ZoomIt:  https://docs.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/zoomit

value.title: Create a Power BI streaming dataset for real-time dashboards
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how to create a Power BI streaming dataset and use that to create a real-time dashboard. You can easily use something like PowerShell to push data into the Power BI streaming dataset.  Demo files - https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com
